content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Accessibility Tree with numerical label representing information about the page, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
4) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {Accessibility Tree of a web page}

Now given a task: Find the video on YouTube: 'Oscars 2023: Must-See Moments!'. Tell me who the first comment displayed under that video belongs to, and how many thumbs up and replies it has.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/ and get the answer.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to search for YouTube video title using Google search box.
Action: Type 1; Oscars 2023: Must-See Moments! YouTube video
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Google triggered a "sorry" captcha page. Need to go back and try a gentler search.
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Try a simpler Google query to avoid captcha, searching "Oscars 2023 Must-See Moments youtube".
Action: Type 1; Oscars 2023 Must-See Moments youtube
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Use Google apps menu to open YouTube directly, bypassing Google search captcha.
Action: Click 88

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Return to the previous Google home page where the Google-apps grid (button 88) is present, then we can use it to access YouTube directly.
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Open the Google apps grid to select YouTube directly.
Action: Click 88
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to enter the Google-apps iframe to reveal the list of services so we can click YouTube.
Action: Click 1539
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Use Google search box to search for the video directly; it’s simpler than the apps grid route.  
Action: Type 1; Oscars 2023 Must-See Moments YouTube
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to inspect/open the Google-apps iframe (1539) to locate the YouTube link inside the grid so we can click it.
Action: Click 1539

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The Google-apps grid is open in iframe 1539; I need to scroll inside that iframe to reveal the service icons (including YouTube) so I can click it.  
Action: Scroll 1539; down

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Return to the previous page (Google homepage) to escape the CAPTCHA page, then we can access YouTube by other means.  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Perform a Google search for the YouTube video so we can open it.  
Action: Type 1; Oscars 2023: Must-See Moments! YouTube
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Avoid CAPTCHA by returning to Google homepage, open Google-apps grid and choose YouTube directly.  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Open the Google apps grid to access YouTube directly and avoid search CAPTCHA.  
Action: Click 88
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Focus inside the Google-apps iframe to reveal its contents so I can choose YouTube.  
Action: Click 1539
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Scroll inside the Google-apps iframe to reveal service icons like YouTube.  
Action: Scroll 1539; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Use Google search bar to search for the desired YouTube video directly.  
Action: Type 1; YouTube Oscars 2023 Must-See Moments
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Sorry" CAPTCHA page appeared again. I'll return to the Google home page and open the Google-apps grid to reach YouTube directly.
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Open the Google-apps grid so I can pick YouTube directly.  
Action: Click 88
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Give the Google-apps iframe a moment to load its contents so that the list of services (including YouTube) appears.  
Action: Wait
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Use Google search box to try a simpler query (“Oscars 2023 Must See Moments video”) that may avoid the CAPTCHA.  
Action: Type 1; Oscars 2023 Must See Moments video
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Return to the previous Google homepage (avoids the CAPTCHA) so I can open the Google-apps grid again and try to reach YouTube directly.  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Open the Google-apps grid to access the YouTube link directly (avoiding Google search CAPTCHA).
Action: Click 88
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Try scrolling the main window to see if the contents of the opened Google-apps grid (inside iframe 1539) appear in the accessibility tree so I can locate the YouTube icon.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Try a very short, generic query to see if Google search will work without triggering CAPTCHA – limiting to “Oscars 2023 moments youtube”.
Action: Type 1; Oscars 2023 moments youtube
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The “Stay signed out” overlay is blocking the Google-apps list. Dismiss it so the YouTube icon can become visible.
Action: Click 553

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: We’re on Google’s CAPTCHA “Sorry” page again. Need to return to the regular Google home page, dismiss the “Stay signed out / Sign in” banner, then open the Google-apps grid to reach YouTube directly (bypassing search).  
Action: GoBack

Observation: please analyze the accessibility tree and give the Thought and Action.

	[561] button 'Sign in'

Thought: Dismiss the “Sign in to Google” overlay by choosing “Stay signed out” so that the page becomes interactive.  
Action: Click 553

Observation: please analyze the accessibility tree and give the Thought and Action.

Action: Click 88

Action: Click 1539
